metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7972 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The (1) libxl_set_memory_target function in tools/libxl/libxl.c and (2) libxl__build_post function in tools/libxl/libxl_dom.c in Xen 3.4.x through 4.6.x do not properly calculate the balloon size when using the populate-on-demand (PoD) system, which allows local HVM guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) via unspecified vectors related to "heavy memory pressure."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3

No subscription required
